sn12.43:1.2: “Mendicants, I will teach you the origin and ending of suffering.
sn12.43:1.3: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
sn12.43:2.1: “And what, mendicants, is the origin of suffering?
sn12.43:2.2: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights. The meeting of the three is contact.
sn12.43:2.3: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn12.43:2.4: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn12.43:2.5: This is the origin of suffering.
sn12.43:3.1: Ear consciousness arises dependent on the ear and sounds. …
sn12.43:3.2: Nose consciousness arises dependent on the nose and smells. …
sn12.43:3.3: Tongue consciousness arises dependent on the tongue and tastes. …
sn12.43:3.4: Body consciousness arises dependent on the body and touches. …
sn12.43:3.5: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and thoughts. The meeting of the three is contact.
sn12.43:3.6: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn12.43:3.7: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn12.43:3.8: This is the origin of suffering.
sn12.43:4.1: And what is the ending of suffering?
sn12.43:4.2: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights. The meeting of the three is contact.
sn12.43:4.3: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn12.43:4.4: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn12.43:4.5: When that craving fades away and ceases with nothing left over, grasping ceases.
sn12.43:4.6: When grasping ceases, continued existence ceases.
sn12.43:4.7: When continued existence ceases, rebirth ceases.
sn12.43:4.8: When rebirth ceases, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress cease.
sn12.43:4.9: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.
sn12.43:4.10: This is the ending of suffering.
sn12.43:5.1: Ear consciousness arises dependent on the ear and sounds. …
sn12.43:5.2: Nose consciousness arises dependent on the nose and smells. …
sn12.43:5.3: Tongue consciousness arises dependent on the tongue and tastes. …
sn12.43:5.4: Body consciousness arises dependent on the body and touches. …
sn12.43:5.5: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and thoughts. The meeting of the three is contact.
sn12.43:5.6: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn12.43:5.7: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn12.43:5.8: When that craving fades away and ceases with nothing left over, grasping ceases.
sn12.43:5.9: When grasping ceases, continued existence ceases.
sn12.43:5.10: When continued existence ceases, rebirth ceases.
sn12.43:5.11: When rebirth ceases, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress cease.
sn12.43:5.12: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.
sn12.43:5.13: This is the ending of suffering.”
